metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1270 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In GraphicsMagick, a heap buffer overflow was found when parsing MIFF.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1270` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8').
